text: Ivan Minchov Vazov (; – 22 September 1921) was a Bulgarian poet, novelist, and playwright. He is often called "the Patriarch of Bulgarian literature". He was born in Sopot. This town was then apart of the Ottoman Empire. Ivan Vazov has the highest title of the Bulgarian Academy of Sciences. He was the Education and People Enlightenment Minister from September 7, 1897, until January 30, 1899. He was apart of the People's Party. ==References== === Citations === * * * * * Ташев, Ташо.
